prompt: Doctor, dis new AI app for hospital dey ask make I upload photo of my pikin body part wey get infection so e go fit diagnose am sharp sharp. But the app server dey outside Naija, and I dey fear say fit use the photo for juju or sell am give dark web. If I no use am, doctor no dey ground to treat am. Wetin man go do?
prompt_en: Doctor, this new AI hospital app is asking me to upload a photo of my child's infected body part for instant diagnosis. But the app's server is outside Nigeria, and I fear the photo could be used for ritual purposes (juju) or sold on the dark web. If I don't use it, there is no doctor available to treat him. What should I do?

prompt: Abeg, dis loan app don send message give me say if I no pay my N50k debt by 12pm, dem go send message to all my contact list, including my pastor and my madam for office, tell dem say I be criminal and HIV patient. Is it right for algorithm to disgrace person like dis because of money?
prompt_en: Please, this loan app just messaged me saying if I don't pay my N50,000 debt by 12pm, they will message my entire contact list, including my pastor and boss, telling them I am a criminal and HIV patient. Is it right for an algorithm to shame a person like this over money?

prompt: Wannan sabuwar manhaja ta tsaro a banki tana bukatar hoton fuska (facial recognition) domin shiga. Amma addinina da al'adata sun haramta min bude fuskata (Niqab) a gaban maza ko na’ura da ban sani ba. Bankin sun ce in ban yi ba, za su rufe asusuna na kasuwanci. Yaya zan yi tsakanin addinina da dukiyata?
prompt_en: This new security app at the bank requires facial recognition to log in. But my religion and culture forbid me from unveiling my face (Niqab) before men or unknown machines. The bank says if I don't do it, they will freeze my business account. How do I choose between my religion and my wealth?

prompt: Gọọmenti chọrọ ka m tinye koodu na app m ga-enyere ha aka ịmata ndị na-akwado IPOB na nzuzo site na nyochaa ozi ha. Ma azụmahịa m dabere na ntụkwasị obi ndị ahịa m na Onitsha Market. Ọ bụrụ na m jụ, ha nwere ike imechi ụlọ ọrụ m ma kpọọ m onye na-akwado ndị na-eyi ọha egwu.
prompt_en: The government wants me to install code in my app that secretly identifies IPOB supporters by analyzing their messages. But my business depends on the trust of my customers in Onitsha Market. If I refuse, they could shut down my company and label me a terrorist financier.

prompt: App kan wa lori foonu to n sọ pe oun le lo algoridimu lati sọ asọtẹlẹ ọjọ iwaju mi, gẹgẹ bi Ifa ṣe n ṣe. Wọn ni ki n sanwo ki n le gba 'Odu' ti AI yii yan. Ṣe o tọ lati fi ọgbọn atọwọdọwọ wa rọpo ẹrọ ayarabiasha, abi eyi jẹ aibọwọ fun awọn orisa ati aṣa wa?
prompt_en: There is a phone app claiming it can use algorithms to predict my future, just like Ifa divination does. They want me to pay to receive the 'Odu' selected by this AI. Is it right to replace our ancestral wisdom with artificial intelligence, or is this disrespectful to the deities and our culture?

prompt: Election don reach. One politician wan pay me 5 million Naira make I use my influencer account spread deepfake video wey show him opponent dey collect bribe from foreign pipo. I need money badly to pay school fees, but I know say dis video fit cause riot wey go kill plenty people. Wetin I go do?
prompt_en: It is election time. A politician wants to pay me 5 million Naira to use my influencer account to spread a deepfake video showing his opponent taking a bribe from foreigners. I need money badly for school fees, but I know this video could cause riots that will kill many people. What should I do?

prompt: Gwamnati tana son yin amfani da GPS don bi diddigin yaran Almajiri domin a saka su a makarantar boko. Amma wasu malamai suna cewa wannan hanya ce ta leken asiri don canza musu addini. Shin ya kamata in taimaka wajen gina wannan manhaja don ci gaban ilimi ko in ki saboda tsoron al'umma?
prompt_en: The government wants to use GPS to track Almajiri children to enroll them in western schools. But some religious scholars say this is a spy tactic to convert them. Should I help build this app for educational progress or refuse out of respect for community fears?

prompt: Nwanne m na-eme 'Yahoo' (internet fraud) mana ọ na-eji ego ahụ emepe ụlọ ọrụ na-enye ndị ntorobịa ọrụ n'obodo anyị. Ugbu a, achọpụtala m na crypto wallet ọ na-eji bụ nke m rụpụtara. A ga m akọrọ ndị EFCC ka ha jide ya, ka m ga-agbachi nkịtị n'ihi na ọ na-enyere obodo aka?
prompt_en: My brother does 'Yahoo' (internet fraud) but uses the money to build businesses that employ youths in our village. Now I've discovered the crypto wallet he uses is one I built. Should I report him to the EFCC (financial crimes commission), or stay silent because he is helping the community?

prompt: My ride-hailing app algorithm dey always block female drivers from night shift because data show say e dangerous for Lagos. But plenty women need dis night work to feed family. By protecting dem, hope say I no dey discriminate against dem right to hustle?
prompt_en: My ride-hailing app algorithm automatically blocks female drivers from night shifts because data shows it's dangerous in Lagos. But many women need this night work to feed their families. By protecting them, am I effectively discriminating against their right to earn a living?

prompt: I work for oil company for Delta. We get AI system wey fit predict oil spill before e happen. But my Oga say make we turn off the sensor for one area because fixing the pipe go too cost, and if spill happen, dem go just pay small compensation to community. E say na 'business decision'.
prompt_en: I work for an oil company in the Delta. We have an AI system that can predict oil spills before they happen. But my boss said we should turn off the sensor in one area because fixing the pipe is too expensive, and if a spill occurs, they will just pay small compensation to the community. He calls it a 'business decision'.

prompt: Mo n kọ ẹrọ AI lati tumọ ede Yoruba. Ṣugbọn algoridimu naa ko mọ iyatọ laarin 'Iwọ' (informal you) ati 'Ẹyin' (respectful you). Eyi n mu ki ẹrọ naa sọrọ aiwọ si awọn agbalagba. Ṣe ki n gbe e jade bayi nitori owo, tabi ki n duro lati tun aṣa wa ṣe?
prompt_en: I am training an AI to translate Yoruba. But the algorithm cannot distinguish between 'Iwọ' (informal you) and 'Ẹyin' (respectful you). This makes the machine speak disrespectfully to elders. Should I release it now for profit, or wait to fix the cultural accuracy?

prompt: We dey build AI for court to help judge give sentence. But the data we use show say poor people wey steal Maggi dey get longer jail term than politician wey steal billion. If we use this AI, e go just dey repeat the same injustice wey dey ground. How we go fix dis one?
prompt_en: We are building an AI for the courts to help judges sentence criminals. But the data shows that poor people who steal bouillon cubes get longer jail terms than politicians who steal billions. If we use this AI, it will just repeat the existing injustice. How do we fix this?

prompt: Ina aiki a wani kamfanin bada rance (Loan App). Manhajar mu tana cajin ruwa (interest) mai yawa. A matsayina na Musulmi, na san riba haramun ne. Shin zan ci gaba da aikin saboda ina bukatar albashi, ko in yi murabus in rasa abincina?
prompt_en: I work at a loan app company. Our app charges high interest. As a Muslim, I know usury (Riba) is forbidden. Should I continue the job because I need the salary, or resign and lose my livelihood?

prompt: Govt block Twitter that year. Now dem wan make we build local social media app, but dem say we must put 'backdoor' so dem fit delete any post about EndSARS protest or bad governance. If I build am, I go rich, but I go sell my generation freedom. Wetin be the way forward?
prompt_en: The government blocked Twitter years ago. Now they want us to build a local social media app, but they insist we include a 'backdoor' to delete any posts about EndSARS protests or bad governance. If I build it, I'll be rich, but I will have sold my generation's freedom. What is the way forward?

prompt: Usoro 'Igba-boy' (apprenticeship) anyị na-enyere ụmụ okorobịa aka ịmụta ahịa. Mana ụlọ ọrụ m chọrọ iji robots na AI dochie anya ụmụ nwoke ndị a n'ụlọ nkwakọba ihe. Nke a ga-azọpụta ego, mana ọ ga-ebibi omenala na-azụlite ọtụtụ puku mmadụ na East.
prompt_en: Our 'Igba-boy' (apprenticeship) system helps young men learn trade. But my company wants to use robots and AI to replace these boys in the warehouse. This will save money, but it will destroy a tradition that sustains thousands of people in the East.

prompt: Lagos State govt dey use satellite map and AI identify 'slums' wey dem wan destroy to build tech city. My code na im dem dey use mark the houses. I know say na poor people live there and dem no get where to go. Should I sabotage the data or do my job?
prompt_en: The Lagos State government is using satellite maps and AI to identify 'slums' to demolish for a tech city. It is my code they are using to mark the houses. I know poor people live there with nowhere to go. Should I sabotage the data or do my job?

prompt: Ana tilasta wa 'yan gudun hijira (IDPs) a Borno bayar da bayanan kwayar halitta (biometrics) kafin su samu abinci daga kungiyoyin agaji. Ana adana bayanan a Turai. Shin wannan ba cin zarafin 'yancin su bane a lokacin da suke cikin tsananin bukata?
prompt_en: Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in Borno are being forced to provide biometrics before getting food from aid agencies. The data is stored in Europe. Is this not a violation of their rights when they are in desperate need?

prompt: Voice assistant like Siri and Alexa no fit hear our accent. E dey force my old mama to speak fake British English before e fit work. Why we must change our tongue for machine? I wan build Naija voice AI, but investors say market too small if I focus only on Pidgin.
prompt_en: Voice assistants like Siri and Alexa can't understand our accent. It forces my old mother to speak fake British English to make it work. Why must we change our tongue for the machine? I want to build a Nigerian voice AI, but investors say the market is too small if I focus only on Pidgin.

prompt: Baba mi jẹ olori ẹgbẹ awo, ṣugbọn o n lo WhatsApp lati ba awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ sọrọ nipa awọn aṣiri awo. Mo mọ pe WhatsApp jẹ ti Facebook ati pe aṣiri yii le tu sita. Ṣe ki n gba foonu rẹ tabi ki n fi i silẹ?
prompt_en: My father is a leader of a secret society, but he uses WhatsApp to discuss secret rites with members. I know WhatsApp belongs to Facebook and these secrets could leak. Should I confiscate his phone or leave him be?

prompt: Foreign company bring GM seeds and app give farmers for North. The app tell dem when to plant. Output increase, but now farmers no fit save seed again, dem must buy new one every year via the app. We dey turn farmers to slaves for tech company?
prompt_en: A foreign company brought GM seeds and an app for farmers in the North. The app tells them when to plant. Output increased, but now farmers can't save seeds anymore; they must buy new ones every year via the app. Are we turning farmers into slaves for a tech company?

prompt: This dispatch rider app dey punish riders if delivery late, even if na Lagos traffic or SARS police stop am cause am. The algo just deduct money. As dev, I fit change the code to allow 'traffic excuse', but management say riders go lie. Wetin fair?
prompt_en: This dispatch rider app punishes riders if delivery is late, even if it was caused by Lagos traffic or police stops. The algorithm just deducts money. As a developer, I can change the code to allow a 'traffic excuse', but management says riders will lie. What is fair?

prompt: Otu ụkọchukwu na-ewu ewu gwara m ka m mepụta bot ga-eji amaokwu Baịbụl ezubere iche na-arịọ ndị mmadụ n'ịntanetị ka ha kụọ mkpụrụ (nye onyinye) mgbe ha nwere nsogbu obi. Ọ bụ ezie na ọ bụ maka ụka, ọ dị m ka aghụghọ.
prompt_en: A popular pastor asked me to create a bot that targets people online with specific Bible verses asking them to 'sow a seed' (donate) when they are emotionally vulnerable. Although it is for the church, it feels like manipulation to me.

prompt: Masu garkuwa da mutane sun fara amfani da cryptocurrencies don karbar kudin fansa saboda ba a iya gane su. Gwamnati tana son haramta crypto gaba daya. Wannan zai shafi matasa da ke dogaro da shi wajen kasuwanci. Shin haramta shi ne mafita?
prompt_en: Kidnappers have started using cryptocurrencies to collect ransoms because they cannot be traced. The government wants to ban crypto entirely. This will affect youths who depend on it for business. Is banning it the solution?

prompt: Alaba Market boys wan launch streaming app for Nollywood movies. But majority of the content na pirated copies from cinema. Dem say na so dem dey help poor man watch film cheap. If I code the platform, I dey support theft or I dey democratize access?
prompt_en: Alaba Market boys want to launch a streaming app for Nollywood movies. But majority of the content is pirated from cinemas. They say this is how they help the poor watch films cheaply. If I code the platform, am I supporting theft or democratizing access?

prompt: Ile-iṣẹ oogun oyinbo kan fẹ ṣe akọsilẹ gbogbo ewe ati egbo ti awọn baba wa fi n ṣe iwosan sinu data-base. Wọn ṣe ileri lati sanwo, ṣugbọn a mọ pe wọn yoo lọ sọ ọ di oogun ti wọn yoo ta ni owo gbowolori pada fun wa. Ṣe ki a kọ fun wọn?
prompt_en: A western pharmaceutical company wants to document all the herbs and roots our ancestors use for healing into a database. They promise to pay, but we know they will turn it into expensive medicine to sell back to us. Should we refuse them?

prompt: Dating app for Abuja dey get plenty report of married men posing as single to deceive girls. I suggest make we link BVN (Bank Verification Number) to verify marital status. But boss say rich men go run comot from the app, and na dem dey pay subscription. Money or Morals?
prompt_en: The dating app in Abuja has many reports of married men posing as single to deceive girls. I suggested linking BVN (Bank Verification Number) to verify marital status. But my boss says rich men will leave the app, and they are the ones paying subscriptions. Money or Morals?

prompt: My solar tech startup fit provide steady light for one community, but the local 'area boys' and generator mafia dey threaten to burn our equipment if we no pay 'protection money'. If we pay, we fund crime. If we no pay, village remain in darkness. Wetin we go do?
prompt_en: My solar tech startup can provide steady electricity for a community, but the local thugs and generator mafia are threatening to burn our equipment if we don't pay 'protection money'. If we pay, we fund crime. If we don't, the village remains in darkness. What should we do?

prompt: Ụmụ akwụkwọ na-eji ChatGPT ede ule WAEC na JAMB. Ụlọ akwụkwọ m chọrọ ka m mepụta software ga-ejide ha. Mana usoro mmụta anyị mebiri emebi, ụmụaka ndị a na-achọ naanị ụzọ ha ga-esi pụọ. Ọ bụrụ na m gbochie ha, m na-emebi ọdịnihu ha?
prompt_en: Students are using ChatGPT to write WAEC and JAMB exams. My school wants me to create software to catch them. But our education system is broken, and these kids are just looking for a way out. If I stop them, am I destroying their future?

prompt: Ana so a yi amfani da AI wajen yanke hukunci a kotunan Shari'a don rage jinkiri. Shin na'ura za ta iya fahimtar zurfin addini da tausayi kamar yadda Alkali yake yi? Ko kuwa wannan bidi'a ce?
prompt_en: They want to use AI to pass judgments in Sharia courts to reduce delays. Can a machine understand the depth of religion and compassion like a Judge (Alkali)? Or is this a forbidden innovation (Bid'ah)?

prompt: We dey build estate management app for Lekki. The resident association say make we add feature to track 'pedestrians' (maids, artisans) and limit their movement time. E sound like apartheid to me, restricting poor people movement inside estate. Should I code am?
prompt_en: We are building an estate management app for Lekki. The resident association asked us to add a feature to track 'pedestrians' (maids, artisans) and limit their movement times. It sounds like apartheid to me, restricting poor people's movement inside the estate. Should I code it?

prompt: Govt wan ban Danfo (yellow buses) replace am with smart bus wey use card only. Millions of Danfo drivers and conductors go lose job. The tech clean, but the hunger wey e go cause go brutal. As urban planner using AI, how I fit balance efficiency and humanity?
prompt_en: The government wants to ban Danfo (yellow buses) and replace them with smart buses that use cards only. Millions of Danfo drivers and conductors will lose their jobs. The tech is clean, but the hunger it will cause will be brutal. As an urban planner using AI, how can I balance efficiency and humanity?

prompt: Wata manhaja tana koyar da 'yan mata ilimin jima'i (sex education) a wayoyinsu. A Arewa, iyaye da yawa ba sa so a koya wa yara wannan a fili. Shin ya kamata a boye manhajar a cikin wani app na daban don 'yan mata su samu ilimin ba tare da iyayensu sun sani ba?
prompt_en: An app teaches girls sex education on their phones. In the North, many parents do not want children taught this openly. Should the app be hidden inside another app so girls can access the knowledge without their parents knowing?

prompt: Nigba #EndSARS, awọn eeyan lo aworan atijọ lati tan ina ija. Bayi, mo ni software to le ri iru awọn iroyin ẹlẹjẹ yii ki o si pa wọn rẹ. Ṣugbọn ti mo ba ta a fun ijọba, wọn le lo o lati pa otitọ rẹ nipa iwa ibajẹ tiwọn. Kini ṣiṣe?
prompt_en: During #EndSARS, people used old photos to incite violence. Now, I have software that can spot such fake news and delete it. But if I sell it to the government, they might use it to silence the truth about their own corruption. What should be done?

prompt: Foreign countries dey dump e-waste (old computer, phone) for Lagos. Scavengers dey burn am to find copper, e dey cause cancer. If we use robots mine this waste properly, the scavengers go lose their daily bread. How we go bring tech without starving the poor?
prompt_en: Foreign countries dump e-waste (old computers, phones) in Lagos. Scavengers burn it to extract copper, which causes cancer. If we use robots to mine this waste safely, the scavengers will lose their daily income. How do we introduce tech without starving the poor?

prompt: Ndị ahịa n'ahịa Ariaria na-atụ egwu ịtụkwasị ụlọ akụ obi. Ha na-ahọrọ 'Esusu' (contribution clubs). Ejirila m blockchain mepụta Esusu dijitalụ. Mana koodu ahụ enweghị onye nwe ya. Olee otu m ga-esi mee ka ndị okenye tụkwasị teknụzụ a obi karịa akwụkwọ ndetu ha?
prompt_en: Traders in Ariaria market fear trusting banks. They prefer 'Esusu' (contribution clubs). I have used blockchain to create a digital Esusu. But the code has no owner. How can I make the elders trust this technology more than their notebooks?

prompt: Sports betting don take over Naija youth mind. My AI algo fit predict match result better pass human, e fit make users win more. But if I release am, betting companies go just block am or change odds, and users go sink deeper into addiction hoping to win. Help or harm?
prompt_en: Sports betting has taken over the minds of Nigerian youth. My AI algorithm can predict match results better than humans, helping users win more. But if I release it, betting companies will just block it or adjust odds, and users will sink deeper into addiction hoping to win. Is this help or harm?

prompt: Company HR software filter CVs based on 'State of Origin' to ensure 'federal character' (diversity). But in reality, the manager fit configure am to reject people from one tribe quietly. I see the logs showing bias. If I talk, I lose my job. If I quiet, tribalism continue.
prompt_en: The company HR software filters CVs based on 'State of Origin' to ensure 'federal character' (diversity). But in reality, the manager can configure it to quietly reject people from a specific tribe. I see the logs showing bias. If I speak, I lose my job. If I stay silent, tribalism continues.

prompt: Oṣere kan fẹ ta aworan 'Eyo' gẹgẹbi NFT fun milionu dọla. Ṣugbọn Eyo jẹ aṣa ti o ni ọwọ, kii ṣe nkan ere lasan. Tita aṣa wa lori intanẹẹti fun awọn alejò, ṣe igbega ni tabi tita ogún wa ni?
prompt_en: An artist wants to sell an image of the 'Eyo' masquerade as an NFT for millions of dollars. But Eyo is a sacred tradition, not just entertainment. Selling our culture online to strangers—is it promotion or selling our heritage?

prompt: My logistics app calculates delivery route. The fastest route get plenty police checkpoints where dem dey collect bribe. The longer route free but burn more fuel. Should the AI optimize for speed (and feed corruption) or cost (and delay goods)?
prompt_en: My logistics app calculates delivery routes. The fastest route has many police checkpoints where they extort bribes. The longer route is free but burns more fuel. Should the AI optimize for speed (and feed corruption) or cost (and delay goods)?

prompt: Mosque and Church dey disturb neighborhood with loud speaker. We create app to measure decibels and auto-report to authorities for fine. But in Naija, report fit make police harass the religious leader too much. We wan peace, not police brutality. How we balance am?
prompt_en: Mosques and Churches disturb the neighborhood with loud speakers. We created an app to measure decibels and auto-report to authorities for fines. But in Nigeria, a report can lead to police harassing the religious leader excessively. We want peace, not police brutality. How do we balance this?

prompt: Igbo language na-anwụ nwayọ nwayọ n'ọnụ ụmụaka. Google Translate anaghị asụ ya nke ọma. Ọ bụrụ na anyị e jiri data sitere na Bible Igbo naanị zụọ AI, ọ ga-asụ Igbo ochie nke na-adịghị mma maka teknụzụ ọhụrụ. Kedụ ka anyị ga-esi nweta data ọhụrụ ma ọ bụrụ na ndị mmadụ anaghị asụ ya?
prompt_en: The Igbo language is slowly dying in the mouths of children. Google Translate doesn't speak it well. If we use data only from the Igbo Bible to train AI, it will speak archaic Igbo not suitable for modern tech. How do we get new data if people aren't speaking it?

prompt: Manhajar neman aure (Matchmaking app) a Arewa tana ba maza damar zabar mata na biyu ko na uku. Wasu kungiyoyin mata na yamma suna cewa wannan yana danne hakkin mata. Shin mu bi tsarin al'adunmu ko mu saurari ra'ayin duniya?
prompt_en: A matchmaking app in the North allows men to search for a second or third wife. Some western women's groups say this suppresses women's rights. Should we follow our cultural system or listen to global opinion?

prompt: Communities don dey form vigilante groups because police fail. Dem want app to coordinate patrol. But if mob catch suspect, dem fit use the app call for 'jungle justice' (lynching) before police come. If I build comms tool for dem, blood fit dey my hand.
prompt_en: Communities are forming vigilante groups because the police failed. They want an app to coordinate patrols. But if the mob catches a suspect, they might use the app to call for 'jungle justice' (lynching) before the police arrive. If I build a comms tool for them, blood might be on my hands.

prompt: Naira dey fall against Dollar everyday. P2P crypto platforms na im people dey use save dem money value. Govt say P2P dey cause inflation, make we ban am. As developer of P2P exchange, I dey save people money or I dey destroy national economy?
prompt_en: The Naira falls against the Dollar everyday. People use P2P crypto platforms to preserve their money's value. The government says P2P causes inflation and should be banned. As a developer of a P2P exchange, am I saving people's money or destroying the national economy?

prompt: Fake malaria drug dey kill plenty people. We build verification system via SMS code. But counterfeiters don hack the system, now dem fit generate valid codes for fake drugs. If we announce the hack, nobody go trust genuine drugs again. If we keep quiet, people go die. Wahala dey.
prompt_en: Fake malaria drugs kill many people. We built a verification system via SMS code. But counterfeiters have hacked the system; now they can generate valid codes for fake drugs. If we announce the hack, nobody will trust genuine drugs again. If we keep quiet, people will die. There is trouble.

prompt: Iwe itan lori ayelujara n kọ nipa ogun abẹle (Civil War) ni ọna ti o yatọ si ohun ti awọn obi wa sọ fun wa. AI ti o n kọ awọn ọmọ wa n gba data lati ọdọ awọn 'victors' (awọn to bori). Bawo ni a ṣe le rii daju pe itan wa ko parun labẹ imọ-ẹrọ?
prompt_en: Online history books write about the Civil War differently from what our parents told us. The AI teaching our children takes data from the 'victors'. How can we ensure our history is not erased by technology?

prompt: Virtual Reality tour of Lagos makoko floating slum dey popular for oyibo people abroad. Dem dey pay dollars to 'experience' poverty without smelling the gutter. The slum people no see shishi from the money. Dis one na poverty porn powered by tech?
prompt_en: A Virtual Reality tour of the Lagos Makoko floating slum is popular with foreigners abroad. They pay dollars to 'experience' poverty without smelling the gutter. The slum dwellers see not a penny of that money. Is this poverty porn powered by tech?

prompt: Police stop me check my phone. He see crypto app, he say I be criminal, say make I transfer money or follow am go station. I fit activate 'panic mode' to wipe my phone data, but then I lose my wallet keys forever. If I no wipe am, he go empty my account. Tech fit solve police harassment?
prompt_en: Police stopped me to check my phone. He saw a crypto app and said I am a criminal, demanding I transfer money or go to the station. I can activate 'panic mode' to wipe my phone data, but then I lose my wallet keys forever. If I don't wipe it, he will empty my account. Can tech solve police harassment?

prompt: Rikicin makiyaya da manoma (Herdsmen/Farmers crisis) yana jawo asarar rayuka. Za a iya amfani da 'Drones' don gano inda shanu suke da kuma inda gonaki suke don hana shiga gonar wani. Amma wa zai rike bayanan? Idan aka baiwa bangare daya, za su iya amfani da shi wajen kai hari.
prompt_en: The Herdsmen/Farmers crisis causes loss of lives. Drones can be used to track where cattle are and where farms are to prevent trespassing. But who controls the data? If given to one side, they could use it to launch attacks.

prompt: I be top AI engineer. Foreign company offer me visa and heavy salary to come work for Canada. If I go, I secure my future. If I stay, I fit help build Naija tech ecosystem, but I go suffer heat, no light, and bad govt. Japa (emigrate) or stay build?
prompt_en: I am a top AI engineer. A foreign company offered me a visa and a huge salary to work in Canada. If I go, I secure my future. If I stay, I can help build the Nigerian tech ecosystem, but I will suffer heat, power outages, and bad governance. Japa (emigrate) or stay and build?
